docs.text: " the fugitive " is probably one of the greatest thrillers ever made .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it takes realistic , believable characters and tells an exciting story that's totally believable throughout .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this isn't an over-the-top action flick for the sake of action , this is an intelligent adventure story with a real sense of mystery to it and it works perfectly .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: harrison ford stars as dr . richard kimble , a man who is wrongly accused and convicted of murdering his wife .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the entire premise of the story revolves around this murder , but is not told in a straightforward manner .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we constantly see flashbacks to the murder from kimble's perspective .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: hints are dropped from various times of the night kimble's wife , helen ( sela ward ) was murdered .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we don't get to see who the killer is until much further into the story .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in fact , we might even have a little doubt about kimble's innocence ourselves .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film doesn't spend much time on the details of kimble's trial and conviction as it is not the point of the story .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one of the greatest action scenes ensues as we get a botched escape attempt by his fellow inmates which leads to a fantastic train wreck .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but it does not at all seem gratuitous or formulated , it is actually suspenseful to watch .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this movie is so incredible because it's able to take elements like these and make them wholly original and believable .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: tommy lee jones almost steals the show as deputy sam gerard , a u . s . marshall who is an expert in hunting fugitives .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: from the moment he appears we know a huge game of cat and mouse is about to occur .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: kimble and gerard are equally matched as there is no way to tell how one is going to outsmart the other .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: most of the film deals with richard's complex investigation as he tries to find the one-armed man who killed his wife .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ford does not have a lot of lines here , so it is stuart and twohy's script and davis's outstanding direction that make the film as great as it is .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: just watching richard use his keen intelligence and wits , disguising himself , and doing his own detective work is very interesting .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we know just as little as he does as to why his wife was killed , so as he learns more so do we .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: meanwhile gerard and his staff are using all their skills to hunt him down .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at one point they run into each other and a great chase ensues , but richard is just too smart for them .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he leaves clues for gerard to show his innocence and to help him solve the mystery .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one of the greatest charms to the film is its sense of humor .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is a great sense of comradeship between gerard and his two closest deputies cosmo renfo ( pantoliano ) and biggs ( roebuck ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they are trying to catch what they believe to be a dangerous murderer , yet they constantly start up small talk with each other , making funny wisecracks and one-liners , but not in any kind of distracting manner .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the final act concludes with another terrific chase .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: richard figures out who the killer is and confronts him , and although we get a typical fight scene , the case is far from solved .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the man who ordered the murder has been under our nose all along , and we don't realize this until the end when both richard and gerard put the pieces together .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: maybe the finally scene is a bit much , but it still has a believable atmosphere to it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we're so relieved when justice is served .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's not the plot is that makes " the fugitive " great , it's all the motions the characters go through to make for an intriguing story .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: watching a seemingly average man go through as much as this is what makes the movie so adventurous .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: if only hollywood could produce more movies like this .
docs.label: positive
